actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-6, by Mr. Pepper.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1231 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The rule waives all points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 (l)(6) of rule XI. The amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended be the Committee on Public Works and Transportation shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five minute rule. Consideration of amendments made in order shall be limited to three hours. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. No amendments are in order except amendments adding new sections.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 3.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 254 - 159 (Roll no. 7).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1231) to direct the President to establish an emergency board to investigate and report respecting the dispute between Eastern Airlines and its collective bargaining units.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 1231 (Eastern Airlines labor dispute).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1231) to direct the President to establish an emergency board to investigate and report respecting the dispute between Eastern Airlines and its collective bargaining units.
